short_summary: Engineering Services for the Embassy to Canada to the Netherlands, located in The Hague.
description: The Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development has a requirement for Architectural and Engineerin services for security improvements for the Embassy to Canada to the Netherlands, located in The Hague. The Consultant will be responsible for the design of the physical security enhancements and for providing construction administration services during implementation and post-construction services. If necessary, the Consultant will be required to engage or partner with a local architecture firm (Sub-Consultant) to support the development of the project.
full_summary:
**Architectural and Engineering Services for the Embassy of Canada to The Netherlands**
================��

**Synopsis**
------------

The Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD) is seeking a qualified Consultant to provide Architectural and Engineering services for physical security enhancements at the Canadian Embassy in The Hague.

**Requirements**
---------------

- The Consultant will design and develop architectural and engineering solutions for the physical security enhancements of the embassy, ensuring compliance with Canadian standards and requirements.
- The Consultant will provide construction administration services during implementation and post-construction services.
- If necessary, the Consultant may engage or partner with a local architecture firm (Sub-Consultant) to support project development.

**Scope**
----------

The scope of work includes:

- Design of physical security enhancements
- Construction administration services during implementation
- Post-construction services
- Ensuring compliance with Canadian standards and requirements

**Specifications**
-----------------

- The Consultant must have expertise in architectural and engineering services, with a focus on physical security enhancements.
- The Consultant must have experience working on similar projects, particularly in international settings.
- The Consultant must be able to work independently and as part of a team, both locally and internationally.

**Submission Guidelines**
-------------------------

- Interested bidders must submit their qualification documents to the Procurement Branch, DFATD, in accordance with the instructions outlined in the attachment.
- Bidders must provide all required documentation, including their Statement of Qualifications, experience, and qualifications.

**Important Dates**
-------------------

- Tender closing date: Friday, January 19, 2024, at 2:00 PM (EST)
- Tender evaluations will be completed in accordance with the evaluation criteria outlined in the attachment.

**Inquiries**
--------------

For more information, please contact Tanya Di Virgilio at **(343) 548-8491 or via email at [realproperty-contracts@international.gc.ca](mailto:realproperty-contracts@international.gc.ca)**.

Note that I have rephrased the entry to focus on the key requirements and scope of the project, while ensuring that all necessary details are included. I have also reorganized the structure to make it easier to read and understand.
